page.title: 08Ditchling Playgroup l985
page.content: Laura and Naomi play with their doll family in the'home corner'while Alex and Sebastian play with cars;Edwin and Henry like to paint;John and Amy look at books and Charlie makes a space ship out of old boxes and cartons; these are some of the children at Dit_ chling Preschool Playgroup held in the pavilion on the Recreation Ground in Lewes Road.Most of the 20 children on the register live in Ditchling and a few are from Burgess Hill.The Playgroup is seen as a stepping_stone for the 3 and 4 year olds before they go to school; they are encouraged to become a little independent,buttoning their coats,washing their hands, telling their "own news" and they learn to hold a pencil and to use a pair of scissors, to recognise shapes and colours and here they make their first friends.
